input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NIEGOWA MUNICIPALITY. Summary: Collection, Transport and Management of Municipal Waste from the Niegowa Commune. Description: The subject of the order is the collection, transport and management of municipal waste from properties located in the Niegowa Commune and from the selective municipal waste collection point (PSZOK). The task includes servicing single-family properties, multi-family properties, properties with summer houses and other properties used for recreational and leisure purposes, the building of the Niegowa Commune Office, a selective municipal waste collection point in the commune Niegowa. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Annex No. 2 to the SWZ, hereinafter referred to as OPZ, and the contract template - Annex No. 10 to the SWZ. The Ordering Party indicates that the minimum amount of services provided by the parties that will be entrusted to the Contractor on the basis of concluded agreement, will amount to no less than 80% of the estimated amount of waste expected to be collected and transported, where the planned amount of this waste over the entire duration of the agreement is estimated: 1) Unsegregated (mixed) municipal waste - 1040 Mg 2) Separately collected waste (plastics, metal, multi-material waste, glass, paper) - 610 Mg 3) Bio-waste -184 Mg 4) Ash - 762 Mg 5) Large dimensions -350 Mg 6) Tires 30 Mg 7) Renovation waste - 30 Mg 8) Waste electronics and household appliances - 6 Mg 9) Clothing i textiles - 10 Mg 10) Other collected in PSZOK - 4 Mg The contractor is obliged to collect and manage waste in a way that ensures that the commune fulfills its obligations imposed by the Act on maintaining cleanliness.... Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Wysocki in Wałbrzych - plot no. 167 rev. No. 18 Biały Kamień and leading settlement of tasks. 2. The duties of the substitute investor will include, among others: 1) Administration of Agreements concluded by the Ordering Party with Contractors of Works on the Task. 2) Cooperation with the Ordering Party in the implementation of contracts concluded by the Ordering Party with Institutions co-financing the Task. 3) Fulfilling, on behalf of the Ordering Party, all obligations arising from the implementation of the Task, specified in the provisions of Polish law, in particular the Labor Code with implementing acts. 4) Representing the Ordering Party during the implementation of the Agreement towards the authorities, offices, courts, partners of the Task and other institutions, including carrying out the activities provided for in the Pb related to obtaining the required permits, decisions, notifications, opinions and approvals. 5) Acting as a full-service director investor supervision in accordance with Art. 25 Pb: a) representing the Ordering Party at the construction site by checking the compliance of its implementation with the design and construction permit, regulations and principles of technical knowledge, b) quality checking performed Works and built-in construction products, and in particular preventing the use of defective construction products and those not approved for use in construction, c) checking and acceptance of Works to be covered.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MINISTRY OF DIGITIZATION. Summary: Comprehensive Service of Preparing the Exhibition Stand of the Ministry of Digitization during the Mobile World Congress (Mwc) 2026 in Barcelona. Description: 1. The subject of the order is a comprehensive service consisting in the design, construction, assembly and disassembly of exhibition structures along with technical support of the stand during the international trade fair Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2026 in Barcelona. The detailed description of the subject of the order constitutes Annex No. 1 to the Specification, and the order will be implemented on the terms specified in the Draft Provisions of the contract constituting Annex No. 2 to the Specification. 2. The Ordering Party provides for the possibility invalidation of the contract award procedure if the public funds that the contracting authority intended to use to finance all or part of the contract were not awarded (in accordance with Article 257 of the Public Procurement Act). 3. The Ordering Party, in accordance with Art. 222 paragraph 4 of the Public Procurement Act specifies the amount it intends to allocate to finance the order, i.e. PLN 1,500,600.00 gross. 4. DATE OF THE FAIR: March 2 - 5, 2026 (Monday - Thursday), from 08:00 to 19:00. 5. The offer must include the document referred to in Chapter XV of the SWZ, i.e.: Concept and visualization of the development of the exhibition space, if the Contractor applies for points in the evaluation criterion. 6. Deadline for completing the order: from the date of signing the contract to March 15, 2026, and taking into account the deadlines referred to in the Draft Provisions of the Agreement constituting Annex No. 2 to the SWZ. Comprehensive service of preparing the exhibition stand of the Ministry of Digitization during the Mobile World Congress.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE FOREST FARM STATE FORESTS OLESNO FOREST DISTRICT. Summary: Construction of Gates and Damming Thresholds in the Olesno Forest District - Preparation of Complete Documentation, Obtaining the Required Consents and Carrying out Construction Works. Description: The subject of the order is "Construction of gates and damming thresholds in the Olesno Forest District - preparation of complete documentation, obtaining the required consents and carrying out construction works", based on the attached: Functional and Utility Program - "Execution design documentation and construction works for small lowland retention facilities in the Olesno Forest District - part I: Preparation of design documentation and construction works for the construction of gates and damming thresholds" in Annex No. 10 to the SWZ. Small retention means activities that improve the ability to collect water in small natural and artificial reservoirs and its damming in river beds, streams, canals and ditches for subsequent alimony to the environment. The purpose of the investment construction works based on the design documentation will primarily focus on improving the moisture of forest soils, changing the unfavorable, rapid outflow of surface water from forest areas to a slower outflow, diversifying the elements of the forest ecosystem and beneficial impact on biodiversity. The subject of the order was divided into 5 parts (Packages). Pursuant to Art. 134 section 2 point 3 of the PZP, the Ordering Party informs that the Contractor may submit an offer for all 5 parts. The maximum number of parts that can be awarded to one Contractor - 5 parts. Package No. 1 - Seven Springs Forestry Task no. 02-21-1.2-01 - Construction of a gate in the Siedem Źródeł Forest District 04-223-f Package No. 2 - Seven Springs Forestry Task no. 0.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PACZKÓW COMMUNE. Summary: Construction of a Sanitary Sewage System in Kamienica - Stage Ii. Description: The task will be implemented in the town of Kamienica in the Nysa poviat, Paczków commune, on plots no. 1516 AM-6 of Paczków district and plot no.: 494, 495 496, 980, 995/1, 997, 1000, 1003, 1004/1, 1352, 1388, 1477, 1481, tenement house district. The investment is located in a town outside the designated agglomeration area within the meaning of Art. 86 of the Act of July 20, 2017, Water Law (Journal of Laws of 2023, item 1478, as amended) in accordance with the Update of the National Program for the Treatment of Municipal Watercourses. Currently the project is dedicated to 129 residents of the town of Kamienica. The scope of the task includes the construction of a gravity and rolling sanitary sewage network in the town of KAMIENICA. As a result of the task, 1.25 km of sewerage network will be created. including as part of design work 43 sewage connections were designed. In the town of Kamienica, as part of stage II, there is currently no sewage network, and sewage is discharged into septic tanks. The project assumes the construction of a network in the town of Kamienica, including transit and inclusion in existing network. Detailed information is included in the technical documentation constituting Annex No. 4 to the SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-09. Competition: ICB. The investment is planned to be partially carried out using the material provided by the Ordering Party, i.e.: 1) 2 pcs. BIO MAX PLUS 100 kW anchors with a KIPI burner,2) 2 pcs. Module B extending the regulation. ecoMAX860,3) 2 pcs. 1200l pellet tank4) 1 pc. ecomax 850C controller45) 2 pcs. CT6-P external weather sensor,6) 10 pcs. CT4 temperature sensor 4 mb.The technical specification and parameters of the anchors are indicated in the Detailed Design (constituting Annex No. 4a to the SWZ). Within 7 days of informing the Ordering Party in writing, the cats will be entrusted to the Contractor on the basis of the material entrustment protocol. Ordering party from Due to the multifunctional boiler room in the building, it is possible to hand over the construction site after March 1, 2026.

Summary: Agglomeration System of Bicycle Paths in the Zit Mof Piła Area - Construction, Reconstruction and Expansion of Pedestrian and Bicycle Routes and Bicycle Paths in Piła - Location Ii (Repeated Ii). Description: The subject of the order is the construction of a pedestrian and bicycle route on the extension of Chatellerault boulevards along the Gwda River to the Sigismund the Old Bridge, along with the construction of lighting. The design documentation assumes the construction of a road for pedestrians and bicycles along with the construction of lighting construction of retaining walls on plots with registration numbers 359/2, 359/3, 359/4, 388, 680, 682, 683, Pia 18 area. The length of the pedestrian and bicycle infrastructure construction section is approximately 430 m. The project assumes the construction of a pedestrian and bicycle route with a surface parts for pedestrians made of concrete cubes on a cement-sand ballast and parts for bicycles with an asphalt concrete surface. The basic foundation for the pedestrian and bicycle route is made of a mixture not containing aggregate. A layer should be placed under the foundation layer improved soil stabilized with a hydraulic binder - after obtaining the secondary deformation modulus and soil compaction index consistent with the design. In the construction section from hm 2+61.62 to hm 3+11.75, the soil should be replaced with compacted sand ensuring the permeability of rainwater. Nowa in Mielec, which the Mielec Municipality joined on the basis of Resolution No. LXX/718/2024 of the City Council in Mielec of February 22, 2024. regarding the commencement of preparation of the Local Spatial Development Plan at ul. Nowa in Mielec; stage III obtaining the necessary opinions and agreements; stage IV conducting consultations social; 5th stage: adoption of the Plan and submission of the resolution to the Podkarpackie Voivode. The subject of the order must be completed within 22 months from the date of providing the Contractor with the planning materials referred to in section 6 of the contract template. Detailed issues regarding the deadline for the implementation of the contract are regulated in the contract template constituting Chapter II of this ToR.

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE WATER HOLDING POLISH WATERS. Summary: Maintenance, Conservation and Drainage Works of Rivers in the Area of ​​The Catchment Management Board in Koło. Description: 1. The purpose of the procedure is to conclude a framework agreement between the Ordering Party and a maximum of eight Contractors for a given part of the order, in order to establish the terms of the orders that may be awarded within a period of up to 36 months from the date of signing contracts. The Framework Agreement is valid from the date of signing the Framework Agreement by the Parties, for a period of 36 months, but no longer than until December 31, 2028 or until the completion of Works with a value equal to the gross amount specified in § 9 section 2 Agreements Framework. 2. The works will consist in ongoing maintenance of natural streams and water facilities in order to maintain and improve their technical efficiency. Watercourses and water facilities covered by maintenance in the years 2026-2028 (framework agreement) are located in Greater Poland and are under the supervision of PGW Wody Polskie of the Koło Catchment Management Board. 3. Pursuant to Art. 7 point 26 of the Public Procurement Law, a framework agreement - should be understood as an agreement concluded between the Ordering Party and one or more Contractors, the purpose of which is to establish the conditions regarding orders that may be awarded in a given period, in particular prices and, if necessary, expected quantities. 4. The scope and type of work to be performed under the subject of the order for individual parts is included in attachments: •Appendix No. 2 - Description of the subject of the Order •Appendix No. 2a - Detailed scope of the subject of the order •Appendix No. 3 - Framework price forms •Appendix No. 4 - Contract template 5. The subject of the order is the construction of a complete building of an indoor sports swimming pool equipped with 8 swimming lanes, 25 m long, with an additional, separate shallow basin, equipped with play equipment for children. The sports swimming pool will be equipped with: a movable bottom of two swimming lanes, separated from the rest of the swimming pool by a movable bulkhead. The order also includes the necessary remaining infrastructure of the swimming pool building, in particular: sports, locker rooms, sanitary, communication, technical, technological, storage, social, changing rooms and swimming pool facilities (level -1: basement, swimming pool technology, technical and technological facilities, sub-basin hall, rooms, technical and technological installations and equipment, rooms social, level 0: swimming pool hall, sanitary, cloakroom, entrance, sports, social, level +1: technical part, administration, level +2: roof, renewable energy sources). The building will be equipped with the necessary installations and devices, including: in particular, such as: sanitary, electrical, water and sewage, ventilation, low-current, BMS, fire protection, technological, swimming pool technology, lighting, evacuation, technical and renewable energy sources. The task must also be completed necessary land development, in particular parking lots, sidewalks, access roads, communication, land development, connections, installations, devices, small architecture, green areas and other necessary infrastructure.... Summary: Design and Construction of National Road No. S11 Szczecinek - Piła, Section i Turowo - Podgaje Junction (With Junction).. Description: The subject of the order is the design and construction of the S11 expressway on section No. I, Turowo - Podgaje junction (with junction) from km 0+000 (border of plots no. 346/6 and 319/10, Turowo district, West Pomeranian Voivodeship, Szczecinek poviat, commune Szczecinek rural area) up to km 22+420 (boundaries of plots no. 138/2 and 139/3, Podgaje precinct, Greater Poland Voivodeship, Złotów poviat, Okonek commune). The beginning of the section in question is connected to the dual carriageway section of the existing S11 road specified at km 11+400 for the section constituting the bypass of the city of Szczecinek. The end of the section of the S11 expressway in question will be continued with the planned section of the section. No. II, i.e. Podgaje (without the junction) - Jastrowie junction (with the Turowo junction). - Podgaje junction (with a junction) with a dual carriageway cross-section. The planned S11 Szczecinek - Piła road on the Turowo - Podgaje junction (with the junction) is a fragment of the S11 Kołobrzeg - Poznań road. The length of the designed section is 22+420 km. Investment is located in the southern border of the West Pomeranian Voivodeship in the Szczecinek poviat, within the administrative borders of the Szczecinek rural commune, and in the northern part of the Greater Poland Voivodeship in the Złotów poviat, in administrative boundaries of the communes: Okonek and Jastrowie. All necessary design studies must be carried out, the necessary opinions and technical conditions, all arrangements, permits, consents must be obtained on behalf of and on behalf of the Ordering Party.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-11. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: GENERAL DIRECTORATE FOR NATIONAL ROADS AND MOTORWAYS. Summary: Construction of the Milicz Bypass Along Dk 15. Description: The subject of the order is the design and construction of the Milicz bypass: a main expressway road with a length of approx. 10.130 km. The Milicz bypass covered by the study is located in the Lower Silesian Voivodeship, in its north-eastern part. The route runs entirely through the urban-rural commune of Milicz, located in the Milicz poviat. The construction of the Milicz bypass along national road No. 15 will improve the capacity of the communication system connecting the road the S5 expressway with the national road No. 11 in Jarocin, and in the future with the S11 expressway. The Milicz bypass will eliminate transit traffic from the city center, which is characterized by dense residential development. Please do everything necessary design studies, obtain on behalf of and for the benefit of the Ordering Party the necessary opinions and technical conditions, all arrangements, permits, approvals, decisions and approvals necessary for the execution of the Contract in accordance with the Ordering Party's Requirements and the Contract Conditions, perform construction works and obtain occupancy permit decisions for the entire scope of the investment on behalf and on behalf of the Ordering Party. The detailed scope of the Works to be performed as part of the Contractor's obligations is presented in the Program Functional and Utility. The Ordering Party does not reserve the obligation for the Contractor to personally perform key tasks. Order value above EUR 20 million. Construction of the Milicz bypass along DK 15 The subject of the order.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL AGRICULTURE SUPPORT CENTER, FIELD BRANCH IN WROCŁAW. Summary: Liquidation of Illegal Waste Dumps Located on Properties Belonging to the Agricultural Property Stock of the State Treasury in the Province. Lower Silesia. Description: The subject of the order is the liquidation of illegal waste dumps located on properties belonging to the Agricultural Property Stock of the State Treasury in the province. Lower Silesia. The order was divided into 3 separate procurement items. Items orders cannot be divided by Contractors, offers that do not include the full scope of the subject matter of the order specified in the partial task will be rejected. The scope of work includes, among others: a) Sorting (segregation) of waste, b) Loading onto trucks sorted waste, c) Transport of waste to the place of collection or processing, (d) In the case of hazardous waste, transfer to a final recovery process or final disposal process by the holder of the waste carrying out such process, e) Laying out the area after completing the works, f) Marking the area by placing information boards about the prohibition of dumping garbage. Additional obligations of the Contractor: a) taking over the area of illegal dumping sites. Upon taking over the land, the Contractor stops become the owner and producer of waste. b) immediate commencement of the execution of the subject of the order, c) development of the acquired land at your own expense, d) carrying out work in a way that ensures protection of the natural environment and fire protection and occupational health and safety, e) written notification to the Ordering Party about the planned final acceptance at least 7 days in advance, f) providing the Ordering Party with proof of transfer of waste after.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: GENERAL DIRECTORATE FOR NATIONAL ROADS AND MOTORWAYS. Summary: Design and Construction of the Międzybórz Bypass Along Dk 25, Approx. 8.45 Km Long. Description: The subject of the order is the design and construction of the Międzybórz bypass: a main expressway road with a length of approx. 8.45 km. The beginning of the planned bypass along national road No. 25 is located on the northern side of the city of Międzybórz, while the end is located on the southern border of the village of Oska Piła, at the junction of the existing national road No. 25 with the district road No. 1490D. The above section is a fragment of the road connection between Antonin and Oleśnica and is located at in the Lower Silesian Voivodeship, in the Oleśnica poviat, in the Międzybórz commune. All necessary design studies must be carried out, the necessary opinions and technical conditions, as well as all arrangements must be obtained on behalf of and on behalf of the Ordering Party, permits, permits, decisions and approvals necessary for the execution of the Contract in accordance with the Employer's Requirements and Contract Conditions, perform construction works and obtain occupancy permit decisions for the entire scope on behalf of and on behalf of the Employer investment. The detailed scope of the Works to be performed as part of the Contractor's obligations is presented in the Functional and Utility Program. The Ordering Party does not reserve the obligation for the Contractor to personally perform key tasks. Value orders over EUR 20 million. Summary: "Exercising Investor Supervision over the Task: "Design and Construction Additional Roads Along Dk 7 in the Town of Krzyszkowice.”. Description: The subject of the order is the provision of investor supervision services over the implementation of the contract concluded as a result of the public procurement procedure entitled: Design and construction of additional roadways along Dk 7 in the town of Krzyszkowice in the scope of supervision over design and implementation of construction works. The Ordering Party will entrust Investor Supervision with the provision of the Service, consisting in particular in exercising control and investor supervision over design works and construction works related to the implementation the task referred to above, as well as cooperation with the Ordering Party in order to effectively enforce the requirements specified in the Agreement with the Contractor. As part of the Investor Supervision Service, the Investor's Supervision Service should ensure supervision over the implementation of design and construction works, in particular regarding timeliness, correctness of execution of design documentation, quality of works, materials used, costs of works, acceptance of works, coordination of all activities related to the implementation of the task up to settlement of the task and supervision during the period first 12 months of warranty and warranty.. Swan 4 in Lublin According to Tasks 1-2. Description: Task No. 1 - Reconstruction of the water supply system of the CSR swimming pool complex. The scope of the order includes in particular: - disassembly of the PE water tank - construction of water supply fittings supplying water from a deep well within the room hydrophore system - construction of a bypass enabling the supply of water to the internal installation in the event of a failure of the pump set - installation of a measuring system for periodic control of the operating parameters of each pump. Detailed definition of the scope of the subject the order and its description are included in Appendix No. 2.1 to the SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-14. Competition: ICB. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF OPOLE. Summary: Revitalization of Public Spaces in Opole - Reconstruction and Expansion of the Mdk Branch No. 2 in Opole.. Description: The subject of the order is the reconstruction and expansion of the Branch of the Youth Cultural Center No. 2 in Opole in accordance with the annexes to the SWZ. The order includes, among others: demolition of the single-story annexes, reconstruction of the eastern single-story structure of the back of the facility, including the construction of some parts new walls, new ceilings, reconstruction of the main entrance and emergency exit zones, construction of new shop windows, replacement of some of the existing windows, construction of: roofing of the main entrance, comprehensive insulation of the facility with a new façade, aura cladding on part of the walls, screens facades, new entrance area, internal lift (elevator for the disabled), new sanitary units, new facilities for the dance and theater hall, cloakroom and facilities for the hall of the main hall, separation of an enclosed, smoke-ventilated staircase with new flights staircases, liquidation of a non-standard staircase, acoustic adaptation of the dance and theater hall and mechanical ventilation with heat recovery. The subject of the order was described in detail in the SWZ and annexes.. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Revitalization of Public Spaces in Opole - Reconstruction and Expansion of the Mdk Branch No. 2 in Opole.

Summary: Architectural Services Related to Spatial Planning and Land Development in the Scope of Developing Draft Decisions on the Location of Public Purpose Investments and Decisions on Development Conditions. The developed projects should be consistent with applicable legal provisions, in particular the Act of March 27, 2003 on spatial planning and development (consolidated text: Journal of Laws 2024.1130), Regulation of the Minister of Development and Technology of July 15, 2024 on the method of determining requirements regarding new development and land development in the absence of a local plan spatial development (Journal of Laws 2024.1116), Regulation of the Minister of Infrastructure of August 26, 2003 on the signs and nomenclature used in the decision to determine the location of a public purpose investment and the decision on development conditions (Dz.U.2003.1589).. Summary: Energy Modernization of Public Buildings in Ruda Śląska, Stage Iii - "Thermal Modernization of the Entertainment and Sports Hall at Ul. Hallera 16B". Description: The subject of the order is the performance of construction works related to the thermal modernization of an entertainment and sports hall, the necessity of which results from the poor technical condition, high maintenance costs and non-compliance of the building's energy parameters with currently applicable provisions of Polish law. The building does not meet the current requirements regarding thermal protection in terms of building partitions and window and door joinery. There is also a need to install renewable energy sources and replace fixtures lighting to energy-saving ones. The works will be carried out taking into account the exclusion of the hall from use, however, using such protection measures as will protect the existing fixed and movable equipment as well as external infrastructure. The scope of work includes mainly all: - architectural and construction industries, - sanitary industry, - electrical industry. The subject of the order is the provision of services in the field of maintenance and repair of traffic lights and traffic management and control devices at intersections in the city of Wabrzycha. The task is conducting ongoing and periodic inspections and maintenance of the installation in order to maintain the technical efficiency of the devices, i.e. ensuring the proper operation of control, detection and transmission devices as well as the proper condition of the cable installation and signaling devices, acoustic signals and other devices related to traffic management and control. Description: The task includes the design and construction of a sanitary sewage network with a sewage pumping station in the town of Ksawerw on plots no. 230 and 254, approximately 935 m long. The works will consist in the construction of a 200 mm diameter gravity sanitary sewage system made of PVC pipes, SN8, SDR34, approx. 663 m long, 90 mm rolling sanitary sewage network made of PE SDR 17 pipes, approx. 272 ​​m long, 160 mm sanitary sewage connections made of approx. 68 m long PVC pipes, 10 pieces. The sewage connections will end with connection wells plastic connection chamber fi 425 mm at the boundary of the property or a plastic connection well diameter 425 mm located up to 2 m from the boundary of the plot. The length of the sewage network excavation is approximately 687 m.. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: CAPITAL CITY OF WARSAW - CITY GUARD OF THE CAPITAL CITY OF WARSAW. Summary: Providing Servicing and Repairs of Official Vehicles in the Municipal Police of the Capital City of Warsaw. Warsaw in 2026 with Option Rights. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the provision of servicing and repair services for official vehicles of the City Guard. Warsaw, hereinafter referred to as "vehicles", including towing vehicles, storing wheels and tires, and washing and cleaning vehicle bodies and interiors, hereinafter collectively understood as comprehensive technical service, also referred to as "service". 2. The Ordering Party allows the submission of partial offers and therefore divided the order into two parts (Tasks): 1) Task No. 1 - technical maintenance of vehicles in quantity 57 pieces, assigned to the Branches: OT 6, OŚ and CSK; 2) Task No. 2 - technical maintenance of 65 vehicles, assigned to the Branches: OT 4, OT 7, OS-RI and OS-RZ. 3. Under the contract, the Contractor undertakes to operate the vehicles in accordance with the List vehicles, constituting Annex No. 1 to the contract, in such a way that the technical condition of the vehicles does not raise any objections and enables their safe and failure-free use, confirmed by periodic technical inspections (OT) and important technical tests (registration inspections). 4. The contractor may submit an offer for any number of parts (tasks). 5. REVERSE PROCEDURE! EAT ONLY FROM THE HIGHEST RATED CONTRACTOR! Pursuant to Art. 139 section 2 of the Act, before selecting the most advantageous offer Ordering party will call on the Contractor whose offer was rated the highest to submit, within the specified deadline, a declaration that he was not subject to exclusion and met the conditions for participation in the proceedings on the date of submission.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Expansion, Construction and Reconstruction of the Existing Sewage Treatment Plant in Falenty and the "Stadionowa" Sewage Pumping Station in Raszyn in the Raszyn Commune, Along with the Demolition of Existing Buildings.... Description: Expansion, construction and reconstruction of the existing sewage treatment plant in Falenty and the "Stadionowa" sewage pumping station in Raszyn in the Raszyn commune, along with the demolition of existing buildings... The subject of the order is: Extension, construction and reconstruction of the existing sewage treatment plant in Falenty and the "Stadionowa" sewage pumping station in Raszyn in the Raszyn commune, along with the demolition of existing buildings and construction of a sewage network - in the design and build system. Currently the functioning sewage treatment plant is located on a plot with registration number 3/5, (Falenty district) in the town of Falenty, owned by the Raszyn Commune. The sewage treatment plant in Raszyn is a mechanical-biological treatment plant. Because of operational wear and tear, modernization of technological facilities is required, including the replacement of devices and the automation and control system, the technical and technological solutions of which will take into account the best, advanced and available on the market solutions. The technological line of the sewage treatment plant in Falenty is intended for the treatment of municipal sewage delivered to the treatment plant via a sewage collector or transported by sewage trucks. In addition expansion of the sewage treatment plant is planned in order to increase its capacity for accepting sewage, which will contribute to organizing water and sewage management in the commune. The investment will be implemented by the Contractor in the system "design-build" Due to the significant degree of wear and tear of individual elements of the sewage treatment plant, in response to the needs of the Raszyn Commune, it is necessary to design and build.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: OLSZTYN COMMUNE. Summary: "Traffic Study and Development of a Traffic Model for the Olsztyn Functional Urban Area". Description: 1. The subject of the order is to carry out a traffic study together with the development of a traffic model for the Olsztyn Functional Urban Area. The main goal of conducting traffic research and developing a traffic model for the Olsztyn Functional Urban Area is obtaining current and reliable data on the travel of residents of Olsztyn and the communes of its functional area and preparing an up-to-date traffic model using this data. These data must include all trips made by respondents indicated dates, on weekdays, during morning and afternoon rush hours, both by individual and collective transport. The ordering party divided the order execution into two stages: 1) Stage I: a) methodological preparation b)survey research in households, c) road traffic measurement, d) measurement of passenger traffic, e) test report. 2) Stage II: a) traffic model and forecasts, b)implementation of the acquired data into macrosimulation software, c) acquisition and delivery of the so-called data Big Date d) report on model construction and traffic forecasts. The detailed scope of the service is specified in the Description of the subject of the Order constituting Appendix No. 8 to the SWZ, and the Draft Provisions of the Agreement constituting Appendix No. 7 to the SWZ. Traffic study with developing a traffic model for the Olsztyn Functional Urban Area 1. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: GENERAL DIRECTORATE FOR NATIONAL ROADS AND MOTORWAYS. Summary: Design and Construction of the S11 Piła-Poznań Expressway, Section Ujście - Oborniki, Section i Ujście - Budzyń Junction (With Junction). Description: The subject of the order is the design and construction of the S11 expressway on the section from km 0+000 to km approx. 19+430 (border of plots 184 and 185, Chodzież district, commune: Budzyń, Wyszyny district) along with the connection of the S11 road section to the existing DK11 road (on section from km 18+000 to km 18+783.01 according to km from the study by STEŚ S11 Piła - Ujście). The beginning of the section in question is connected to the dual carriageway section of the planned S11 road on the Piła - Ujście section and inclusion in the existing DK11 using design solutions for the "Ujście" junction. The end of the section in question should be connected to the planned section II, the Budzyń junction (without the junction) - Oborniki (Parkowo). The planned S11 Piła - Poznań road on the Ujście - Oborniki section is a fragment of the S11 Kołobrzeg - Poznań road. The length of the planned section is 20.213 km. The investment is located in the northern part of the Greater Poland Voivodeship, in the Piła and Chodzież counties, within the administrative borders of the following communes: Ujście, Chodzież, Budzyń. The Investment includes two Sections: Section A: connecting a section of the S11 road to the existing DK11 road (section of the S11 road from km 18+000 to km 18+783.01 using some of the design solutions for the "Ujście" junction according to study by STEŚ S11 Piła - Ujście) together with the section of the S11 Ujście - Oborniki road from km 0+000 to km approx. 0+340 (boundary of plots 418 and 415/2 poviat: Piła, commune of Ujście, precinct: Wieś Ujska). Section B: scope of the order beyond Section A.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The subject of the order is the design, construction, commissioning and initial operation of the installation for methane fermentation of waste and construction of a composting plant in the part intended for stabilization of the under-sieve fraction (0-80 mm) and supply of mobile equipment and execution of the necessary accompanying infrastructure on the premises of the "EKO DOLINA" Sp. plant. z o. o. in Łężyce. The project will be implemented on the premises of the existing plant at al. Landscape Park 99 in Łężyce, 84-207 Koleczkowo. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE WATER HOLDING POLISH WATERS. Summary: "Maintenance of Water, Water Facilities and Regulatory Structures in the Area of ​​The Catchment Management Board in Gorzów Wielkopolski (Framework Agreement)". Description: 4.1 The subject of the order is the conclusion of framework agreements for the performance of maintenance works on streams, canals and reservoirs located in the area of ​​operation of the Catchment Management Board in Gorzów Wielkopolski in order to maintain and improve their technical efficiency. Works will include, among others: on mowing the slopes of streams, cutting out bushes, mechanical and manual hacking of the bottom, removing blockages, building bank holes, securing the banks and making bands from fascine pipes. The work will consist of the current one maintaining sections of natural streams and canals and water facilities flowing through the areas of the above-mentioned Water Supervision Authority. Carrying out the above works will help maintain the slopes and bottoms of watercourses in good technical condition and will contribute to ensuring proper conditions for the passage and regulation of water levels in the area of the Catchment Management Board in Gorzów Wielkopolski. Individual partial orders will include, among others: following leading works: - mowing and raking lichens from slopes and the bottom of the stream, removing them sheepskin coat from floating plants, removing blockages, dismantling beaver dams, removing bushes, cleaning culverts; manual and mechanical removal of plants rooting at the bottom of the stream, spreading of organic matter, removal of debris and dams, local narrowings of the riverbed, etc.; repair of riverbed insurance and development of bank breaches; removing natural threats to people and property. 4.2 Detailed scope and type of work to be performed in.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE TREASURY STATE FOREST HOLDING, STATE FORESTS, WIEDZY BRÓD FOREST DISTRICT. Summary: "Service of Inventory of Leks, Monitoring the Population Size of the Capercaillie Tetrao Urogallus, Collecting Samples for Research in the Augustów Forest in 2026, Together with Preparing a Report, Carried out as Part of the Project.... Description: "Service of inventory of leks, monitoring the population size of the capercaillie Tetrao urogallus, collecting samples for research in the Augustów Forest in 2026, together with preparing a report, carried out as part of the project... Material scope of the subject of the order: Purpose of the work covered by the order is to learn the range of the capercaillie and the number of birds occurring naturally in the Augustów Forest and to collect available samples in the field for testing: capercaillie feathers, excrements. The abundance estimation method is used birds using sound recorders. This is a non-invasive method and does not require excessive penetration of the lek area. Direct observations will be an auxiliary method. As part of the order, location and inventory will be carried out leks using sound recorders recording the voices of mating males and females. Additionally, direct observations will be carried out and information about observations from the field will also be collected from forest services and forest workers. The contractor will collect samples - excrement, capercaillie feathers. The results of the order execution will be presented in the report (paper version and digital version on CD/DVD). The number of leks within 4 forest districts, i.e. Wiedzy Bród, Augustów, Pomorze and Płaska is estimated at 14 leks, including active and abandoned ones, identified over the last 16 years. The detailed Order Description is attached as Annex No. 2 to the SWZ "Service of inventory of lekking grounds and monitoring the population size of the Tetrao capercaillie urogallus, a collection of samples for research in the Augustowska Forest in 2026, together with the preparation of a report, carried out as part of the project "Together for Nature - species protection.... output.Summary: "Service of Inventory of Leks, Monitoring the Population Size of the Capercaillie Tetrao Urogallus, Collecting Samples for Research in the Augustów Forest in 2026, Together with Preparing a Report, Carried out as Part of the Project...
output.Description: "Service of inventory of leks, monitoring the population size of the capercaillie Tetrao urogallus, collecting samples for research in the Augustów Forest in 2026, together with preparing a report, carried out as part of the project... Material scope of the subject of the order: Purpose of the work covered by the order is to learn the range of the capercaillie and the number of birds occurring naturally in the Augustów Forest and to collect available samples in the field for testing: capercaillie feathers, excrements. The abundance estimation method is used birds using sound recorders. This is a non-invasive method and does not require excessive penetration of the lek area. Direct observations will be an auxiliary method. As part of the order, location and inventory will be carried out leks using sound recorders recording the voices of mating males and females. Additionally, direct observations will be carried out and information about observations from the field will also be collected from forest services and forest workers. The contractor will collect samples - excrement, capercaillie feathers. The results of the order execution will be presented in the report (paper version and digital version on CD/DVD). The number of leks within 4 forest districts, i.e. Wiedzy Bród, Augustów, Pomorze and Płaska is estimated at 14 leks, including active and abandoned ones, identified over the last 16 years. The detailed Order Description is attached as Annex No. 2 to the SWZ "Service of inventory of lekking grounds and monitoring the population size of the Tetrao capercaillie urogallus, a collection of samples for research in the Augustowska Forest in 2026, together with the preparation of a report, carried out as part of the project "Together for Nature - species protection...

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: LISKÓW COMMUNE. Summary: "Construction of a Sanitary Sewage System in the Towns of Strzałków and Chrusty with Sewage Transfer to Lisków and a Rainwater Sewage System in the Town of Strzałków". Description: The project includes the construction of a sewage network in the towns of Strzaków and Chrusty - located in the Lisków commune, Kalisz district. The location of the sewage pipeline network was designed in communication routes, which include district and municipal roads, and in sections on land private. The sanitary sewage system, with branches to properties interested in connecting residents, consists of gravity sanitary sewers, supported by sewage pumping stations and a system of rolling pipelines. The project also includes internal construction supply line to the sewage pumping station. For the collectors discharging sewage, a single-strand system of pipelines receiving sewage was adopted, with one-sided or double-sided buildings, located along road lanes. In the case of parallel location of gravity collectors and rolling pipelines were designed for technological and economic reasons, they were laid in one trench, rolling pipelines outside the above-mentioned places were made by jacking/drilling. The place of discharge of sewage will be the existing sewage system within the town of Lisków - ul. Lena. The scope of the project concerns the construction of a gravity sanitary sewage system made of PVC-U pipes.... Published Date: 2025-12-20. Closing Date: 2026-01-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: RYMANÓW COMMUNE. Summary: Construction of a Water Distribution Network in Ladzin. Description: The water supply network is planned to be made of PE pipes 160, 110, 90, 63, 40 mm. A technical and technological solution has been designed to minimize the risk of emergency situations. The foundation of the water pipeline should meet the conditions applicable to pipelines made of PE. PE 100RC pipes should be used in accordance with the PAS 1075 standard, which do not require the use of sand bedding and are laid in the ground using traditional, narrow trench and trenchless methods. Pipelines should be laid in accordance with the longitudinal profiles, in depth minimum resulting from the standards, The route of the underground water supply network should be marked with a PVC foil tape with a metallic insert at a depth of 70 cm below the ground. The water supply system being constructed will be equipped with mains and hose shut-off valves and above-ground fire hydrants with shut-off valves. Regulation and measurement chambers should be installed in the water supply network. The scope of work includes the construction of a water supply network and the protection of existing underground utilities intersecting with the planned network. The detailed scope of work is presented design documentation, subsoil documentation, technical specifications and bill of quantities.... Published Date: 2025-12-20. Closing Date: 2026-01-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Osielsko in 2026: divisions real estate, resumption and determination of borders, opinions on demarcation progress, changes in the use of municipal plots, stabilization of border points The subject of the order is the provision of surveying services for the needs of the Osielsko Commune in 2026 in the field of divisions real estate, resumption and determination of boundaries, assessment of the correctness of technical activities in demarcation proceedings, changes in the use of municipal plots and stabilization of border points. The scope of the order includes: 1) Division of real estate, separation, incl. including demarcation in the event that it will be required together with the stabilization of new border points (including staking of old and new borders - a 1m high stake),2) Resumption and determination of borders, including demarcation in the event that it will be required together with the staking of the old and new boundaries (1m high stake),3) Assessment (opinion) of the correctness of technical activities in the demarcation procedure before issuing the approval decision,4) Carrying out the work necessary for the changes use of municipal plots, 5) Stabilization of border points with staking (1m high stakes). The detailed scope and conditions of providing the service are specified in the contract template constituting Annex No. 8 to the SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-12-20. Closing Date: 2026-01-09. This document should be issued collectively for: of a given type of waste for a given month in a given reporting year within 7 days from the last day of the month. The documents provided to the Ordering Party confirming recovery from managed waste and confirmation of the completion of the transport service in the BDO database constitute will be grounds for issuing an invoice by the Contractor. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: TRAWNIKI COMMUNE. Summary: Construction of an Open Retention Reservoir in Biskupice.. Description: 1. The subject of the order is construction work consisting in the construction of an open retention reservoir in the town of Biskupice. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: REGIONAL DIRECTORATE FOR ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN KRAKOW. Summary: Conducting Protective Activities in Xerothermic Habitats in 2 Natura 2000 Areas in the Miechowska Upland - Procedure Iv.. Description: I. 1..1.1.1. The subject of the order is to carry out protective activities in xerothermic habitats in 2 Natura 2000 areas in the Miechowska Upland - Cybowa Góra, Giebułtów. 2. The aim of the action is to improve the structure of the habitat and provide appropriate conditions for xerothermic species, by limiting natural succession and eliminating weevils lying on the surface of the habitat. 3. Protective actions will consist of: a) mowing patches of xerothermic grasslands b) ringing trees c)plucking shrubs and tree saplings up to 2 m high d) collection and utilization of biomass 2. Details of the scope of the subject of this order (including a detailed description of how to complete the task, intermediate deadlines) and maps with marked treatment areas - can be found in Annex No. 9 to SWZ - Description of the Subject of the Order (OPZ). 3. 3. Ordering Party - pursuant to Art. 95 section 1 of the Act - requires the Contractor or subcontractor to employ, under an employment relationship, persons directed by the Contractor or subcontractor to perform activities involving physical work, such as cutting, collecting and transporting biomass, if the performance of these activities involves performing work in the manner specified in Art. 22 § 1 of the Act of June 26, 1974, Labor Code 3.4 Ordering Party reserves the right to invalidate these proceedings pursuant to Art. 257 of the Public Procurement Law, if the funds he intended to allocate for the implementation of the order are not granted to him in whole or in part.... Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-01-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE WATER HOLDING POLISH WATERS. Summary: Maintenance, Maintenance and Drainage Works of Rivers in the Area of ​​The Sieradz Catchment Management Board - Framework Agreement. Description: 1. The purpose of the procedure is to conclude a framework agreement between the Ordering Party and a maximum of eight Contractors for a given part of the order, in order to determine the terms of orders that may be awarded within a period of up to 36 months from the date of signing. contracts. The Framework Agreement is valid from the date of signing the Framework Agreement by the Parties, for a period of 36 months, but no longer than until December 31, 2028 or until the completion of Works with a value equal to the gross amount specified in § 9 section 2 Agreements Framework. 2. The works will consist in the ongoing maintenance of sections of natural watercourses, canals and water facilities flowing through the areas of the Water Supervision Authority under the Catchment Management Board in Sieradz. Performing the above works will allow you to maintain good health technical condition of slopes and the bottom of watercourses will contribute to ensuring proper conditions for the passage and regulation of water levels. 3. Pursuant to Art. 7 point 26 of the Public Procurement Law, a framework agreement - should be understood as an agreement concluded between the Ordering Party and one or a larger number of Contractors, the purpose of which is to establish the conditions regarding orders that may be awarded in a given period, in particular prices and, if necessary, expected quantities. 4. Scope and type of work to be performed as part of the subject of the order for individual parts, it was included in the annexes: - Description of the subject of the order - Annex No. 3 to the SWZ, - Bills of quantities - Annex No. 3 to the SWZ, - Template of the framework agreement - attached.... Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-01-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Development of Design Documentation Entitled "Extension of the District Road No. 3103L Żółkiewka - Celin from Km 3+060 to Km 5+570". Description: The subject of the order is the development of design documentation for the expansion of the district road No. 3103L Żółkiewka - Celin from km 3+060 to km 5+570 with a length of 2,510 km. The planned section of the road is located entirely within the Żółkiewka commune. "L" class road (local). The width of the existing surface is from 5.0 to 5.5 m. Lengths of the network broken down by town: Reconstruction of the network from PE 100 RC SDR 17.6 PN 10 pipes Dn 160 mm and PE fittings Dn 160 mm and cast iron Dn 80 mm with a length of 6994 m. Works earthworks are planned to be drilled using controlled drilling in sections of 100-150 m. Fire hydrants are designed for the network. aboveground Dn 80mm. Branched and hydrant water supply hoses are planned to be made using flanged tees with PE/el transition fittings. The cut-off of the designed sections of the network is planned using flanged gate valves with stubs for PE connections. The water pipeline is deepened to the axis of the pipes 1.90, 2.20 and 2.30, the total length of the water supply network is 6994.0 m. 3. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: KOŁOBRZEG CITY COMMUNE. Summary: Revitalization of the Fountain in the Park. Antoni Szarmach in the Western District of Kołobrzeg as Part of the Citizens' Budget Project. Description: The subject of the order is the execution of the following task in accordance with the specification of the terms of the order and in accordance with the design documentation: Revitalization of the fountain in the park. Antoni Szarmach in the Western district of Koobrzeg as part of the Civic Budget project. On the premises covered by the study, an investment is planned consisting in the revitalization of the park along with the demolition of the existing wall surrounding the pond, the construction of a new fountain (without a fountain sculpture, a separate order is required), a pedestrian bridge and earthworks consisting in providing a connection water supply, sewage and energy supplying devices operating the fountain as well as lighting in the area covered by the study, along with area monitoring.. Description: A two-way bicycle path, approximately 1.9 km long, 2.5 m wide, with a bituminous surface, separated from the road by a roadside ditch and a green belt. Construction of exits from the district road, 6 m wide, made of concrete cubes. Concrete block descents and sections bicycle and pedestrian/bicycle paths limited by concrete curbs. Bituminous road and exit surfaces limited by heavy concrete curbs. Construction of protective barriers. Construction of new lighting for pedestrian crossings in the village of Brzezno. The contractor will deliver documents necessary to complete the construction. The contractor is obliged to apply/implement the provisions contained in the Technical Conditions and Agreements posted on the procedure website. The contractor will ensure that the works are managed by a construction manager with current construction licenses in accordance with the scope of work performed. Courtyards with a length of 320.0 m. The scope of works includes the construction of an asphalt surface consisting of a layer more AC16W 6cm and AC11S wearing course 4cm, along with the construction of a new sub-base, the installation of embedded curbs and drainage on some sections and the construction of exits and shoulders within the road right-of-way.
